subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Readspel
msgSnippet: As far as I know, nobody s created a font for it. That s somewhat of a prerequisite for getting much attention across the web. The external link on the
messageBody:
As far as I know, nobody's created a font for it. That's somewhat of a prerequisite for getting much attention across the web.
   The external link on the Wikipedia page gives an illustration of all three alphabets; that's all I've ever seen of it. It does look interesting . . .

----- Original Message ----
From: Sergey Goldgaber <sgoldgaber@...>
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, August 23, 2008 11:53:06 AM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Readspel

According to http://members.aol.com/RSRICHMOND/quickscript.html

"[Kingsley] Read... went on to abandon the Shaw alphabet forms entirely
for an extensively modified Roman alphabet called Readspel."

There's also a brief Wikipedia article on Readspel:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Readspel

But there's really not much information in there.

Does anyone here have any experience with or knowledge of Readspel?  How
does it compare to Quikscript?  Any idea of why it hasn't caught on like
Quikscript has?



------------------------------------
